description.html:
Ryan O’Shea lives in Berlin, and is learning and development professional with over 10 years of management experience.

He has recruited, hired, onboarded, trained and developed teachers, service staff and consultants, opened schools and won awards.

After 10,000 hours of teaching and training, he has forked his career and is learning a new craft...
Since making the decision to develop a third career, Ryan has added a set of tools and skills need to work on web applications in the MERN stack
After over 10 years of practice in using his design skills as a manager and a teacher and trainer, Ryan brings the following set of skills to the workplace:

Learned to develop web apps with HTML5, CSS, Javascript, React, Node, Express and MongoDB. Also worked with static site generators, server-side rendering, APIs and CDNs, Git and agile development methods.

description.html:
From July 2016 until May 2018, Ryan took time to discover the right path for the next chapter of his working life.

He discovered that the struggle was real, and which skills he needed for the next phase of his working life.

details.description: Co-Founded language service Lost In Translation in Hamburg.
Learning web development at Digital Career Institute, Berlin.
Completed the Foundations Learner Experience Design with NovoEd: learn.novoed.com
Trained German to B2 with GLS Berlin
Created and produced the “Exit Through the Language School” series of events.
Performed live video mixing with The Instant Tigers
Created exitroute.org: a workshop for on-going LX CX SX design and event projects
Completed 2,000km unsupported bicycle trip from Berlin to Barcelona in 28 days.

description.html:
Wall Street English (WSE) was an elearning and blended learning language teaching service active in Germany from 1995 until December 2016, owned by Pearson Education.

Approximately, 18,000 English language learners attended the five schools in Berlin from 2001 until 2016, with an annual €2.7m.

School self-portrait here: Berlin Lesson 1.
